intro: Delphinium cognatum, commonly known as the European larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that bear clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a rough texture. Delphinium cognatum typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is valued in gardens for its ornamental flowers and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
